description:
-> Works on top of new and existing Web Forms applications, allowing the creation of mixed server and client-side server controls using Web standards.

-> State-of-the-art, exclusive way of working with CSS and JavaScript dependencies!

-> Light-weight client-side JavaScript dependencies.

-> Build and run-time CSS and JavaScript combination and minification. 

-> Unobstructive component-oriented UI programming in the client-side using pure JavaScript and jQuery.

-> True object-oriented approach both on client and server side!

-> Decent and rich event-oriented initialization that makes things easier to get done right.
Pure CSS theming support.
releaseNotes:
- JavaScript and CSS manager configuration has been integrated into regular Web.config infrastructure.

- Now JavaScript and CSS manager support the concept of "standalone reference". This means that such kind of references won't get combined with others, rendering a standalone script tag in the whole page.

- Theming. Calipso introduces a theming approach. Learn more on http://calipso.codeplex.com!

- New globalization string resource approach (check documentation on http://calipso.codeplex.com about string localization).

- Some fixes on JavaScript and CSS manager (design decisions now enhanced or replaced by better ones).

- jQuery is still a mandatory dependency, but Calipso requires it as a reference and it's not included in official distribution. That's it's mandatory to add a JavaScript include in Calipso.config <javascriptManager> element. This is better as newer jQuery version can be plugged in Calipso without waiting for a new Calipso release.

- Now JavaScript script tags are still rendered in the ordered on which scripts were added as references in the server side, but references having an identifier starting with "Dependency//" (case insensitive) are rendered first, later the rest. Resources are rendered just after dependencies. 

- Client-side JavaScript PageContext, PageManager objects and base Control class are now available through shortcut variables: $calipso$context, $calipso$manager and $calipso$control. Full namespace paths are still fine and this won't change in the future. It's just for make things easier.

- Lot of fixes on JavaScriptManager and CssManager, specially when those work on non-debug compilation mode (release mode on Web.config).

For more details and how-tos, please visit Calipso's official page on Codeplex http://calipso.codeplex.com
summary: ASP.NET Calipso is an open source project that seamlessly brings rich, client-side programming with regular Web Forms and HTTP features to well-known ASP.NET platform.
title: ASP.NET Calipso
